content:
• Wednesday, August 21, 2013
  • HAIN

    More on Hain Celestial earnings

    • Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN) FQ4 beats estimates across the board. Net profit jumped 11% Y/Y as the maker of organic-products posted sharply higher sales on growth in the U.K.
    • Gross margin narrowed to 26.5% from 26.6%.
    • The company also raises guidance. It now sees an FY profit of $2.95 to $3.05 a share on $2.03B to $2.05B in sales. Analysts are projecting $2.92 a share on roughly $2B, respectively.
    • Separately, the company appoints former Elizabeth Arden Chief Financial Officer Stephen J. Smith to take over the same role at HAIN. Mr. Smith will begin early next month, and succeeds Ira J. Lamel, who announced his retirement nearly a year ago.
    • Shares +7.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 PM
  • CVO

    Cenveo acquires National Envelope for $25M

    • Cenveo shares (CVO +3.8%) are up 8.1% AH following the company's acquisition of National Envelope for $20M in cash and $5M in stock. Other parties will acquire the accounts receivable and inventory of National Envelope, which entered Chapter 11 bankruptcy in June.
    • Upon integration, Cenveo expects the acquisition to add $300M to revenue and $30M in EBITDA. The company hopes the acquistion will expand its product line and geographic reach while achieving cost efficiencies.
    • Previous: Cenveo looks to rally again following big move
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM
  • NOAH

    Noah Holdings beats by $0.04

    • Noah Holdings (NYSE:NOAH): Q2 EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $44.3M (+132.1% Y/Y). Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • HPQ

    H-P now -6.2% AH; company doesn't expect FY14 rev. growth

    • Meg Whitman on the CC: "Total company [Y/Y] revenue growth in [FY14] is unlikely." Ongoing PC and services challenges are blamed for the outlook. H-P (NYSE:HPQ) is currently expected by analysts to see a 2.2% FY14 rev. drop.
    • More from Whitman: "We see a continued weak enterprise spending environment. Sentiment in the U.S. is improving ... I would characterize Europe as challenging and China continues to be soft." Also, "continued pricing pressure" is expected for PCs, printers, and (thanks to Dell?) x86 servers.
    • Investors have already been on edge about enterprise IT spending thanks to Cisco.
    • Whitman doesn't hesitate to throw Dave Donatelli under the bus - she calls H-P's enterprise hardware performance "very disappointing - and suggests the unit's problems are due to execution rather than technology (they'd better be, given R&D is less than 4% of revenue and declining).
    • AllThingsD reports Whitman and Donatelli "had a difficult relationship" even before Donatelli's reassignment, thanks in part to server share losses to Dell.
    • Management strikes a relatively upbeat tone about printing, and says traction for H-P's Ink in the Office initiative has been good.
    • FQ3 free cash flow was $2B, above net income of $1.7B. The presence of "material non-public information" is said to have curtailed buyback activity.
    • More on H-P
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 3 Comments

  • After-hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CVO +10%. HAIN +6%. ARO +5%. AEPI +3%. GFI +3%.
    • Top losers: SMTC -10%. CLDX -5%. AMWD -5%. VVTV -5%. SQNM -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • SMTC

    Semtech plunges AH on weak guidance

    • Semtech shares (SMTC -0.7%) are down 9.5% AH after the company issues Q3 guidance below consensus expectations.
    • Q3 revenue is expected to be $135M-$145M (consensus of $169.4M). EPS is expected to be $0.31-$0.37 (consensus of $0.54). (PR)
    • Semtech increased its buyback authorization by $50M to $92.5M.
    • Gross margin for Q2 was 61%, up from 49.5% in Q2 FY 2013 and 59.9% in Q1 of FY 2014.
    • Yesterday, peer Analog Devices issued guidance for the upcoming quarter that was somewhat light.
    • Conference call scheduled for 5pm ET
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • PSEC

    Prospect Capital higher after surpassing guidance

    • FQ4 net investment income of $92.1M is up 43% Y/Y, and at $0.38 per share exceeds guidance of $0.31 to $0.35, and the $0.33 dividend.
    • Earlier today, company announced cash distributions from August to March 2014, starting at $0.1102 per share this month and ending next March at $0.110375, an annualized yield of about 12% based on today's $10.97 close.
    • June 30 net asset value per share of $10.72 is up $0.01 from March 31. Today's closing price is a 2.3% premium to NAV.
    • FQ1 NII guidance of $0.30 to $0.35 per share.
    • Portfolio of 124 investments with fair value of $4.2B vs. $2.1B a year ago. Annualized current yield of 13.6%. 20 new and follow-on investments completed during Q amounts to a record $798.8M.
    • Earnings call tomorrow at 2 ET.
    • FQ4 results.
    • PSEC +1.3% AH to $11.11.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • INO

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals soars on no specific news driver today

    • The volatility continues in Inovovio Pharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:INO) today, with the stock rising over 32% on no significant news.
    • Last week, the stock too a 9% dip after Aegis cut the shares to Hold.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 13 Comments
  • LB

    Limited Brands beats but guidance is weak

    • Limited Brands (LTD -1.3%) gives investors another read on what has been a Jekyll and Hyde retail trade this week.
    • LTD beats on both lines (albeit narrowly) for Q2.
    • The company's outlook comes in below Street estimates: Q3 and FY13 EPS of $0.23-0.28 and $3.06-3.21 respectively, versus consensus of $0.29 for Q3 and $3.21 for the full year. (PR)
    • Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • KTOS

    Kratos up AH on Dept. of Homeland Security contract

    • Kratos Defense & Security (KTOS +3.5%) is up 4.36% AH after the company secures a Dept. of Homeland Security Blanket Purchase Agreement to provide Continuous Monitoring as a Service as part of the DHS's Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation Program.
    • The agreement has an "estimated value" of $6B with a 1 year base and four 1 year extension options.
    • The stock is up 17.1% in the last 5 days.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • HAIN

    Hain Celestial reports highest quarterly revenue

    • Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN): FQ4 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $463.5M (+32.1% Y/Y) beats by $8.68M. Shares +4.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • HPQ

    H-P EPS in-line, revenue misses; shares lower

    • Hewlett-Packard (NYSE:HPQ): FQ3 EPS of $0.86 in-line.
    • Revenue of $27.22B (-8% Y/Y) misses by $70M.
    • Expects FY13 EPS of $3.53-$3.57 vs. $3.57 consensus.
    • COO Bill Veghte reportedly replacing Dave Donatelli as company's enterprise hardware chief.
    • Shares -3.9% AH. CC at 5PM ET. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • LB

    Limited Brands beats by $0.01, beats on revenues

    • Limited Brands (LTD): Q2 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $2.52B (+5% Y/Y) beats by $0.01B. Shares -3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • RIO

    Credit Suisse: Rio Tinto, Cliffs Natural likely to move in opposite directions

    • Credit Suisse looks at how lower iron ore prices could impact different companies, and finds Rio Tinto (RIO -2.7%) in a far better position than Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -1.9%) thanks to its ability to keep costs low.
    • Rio is the world’s lowest cost iron ore producer of scale, the firm says, and is expanding production in Australia from ~240 metric tons/year to 290 while targeting a 20% reduction in capex in FY13 and again in FY14 and to achieve it.
    • The firm slaps a $10 price target on CLF, implying a drop of more than 50%, as the company’s assets have trouble being profitable without higher iron ore prices.
    • Also: BHP -3.1%, VALE -3.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • NEO

    Neogenomics plunges as BioReference Labs makes another acquisition

    • While correlation doesn't necessarily imply causation, it's probably worth noting that today's action in shares of Neogenomics (NEO -8.4%) mirrors the stock's dismal performance from last Tuesday.
    • The connection: Peer BioReference Laboratories (BRLI +2.5%) announced "strategic acquisitions" both today and on August 13.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 3 Comments
  • SNY

    Cowen downgrades Sanofi

    • Shares of Sanofi (SNY -2.6%) are notably weaker on the day.
    • Earlier, Cowen downgraded the stock to Market Perform from Outperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • BTU

    Peabody ruled responsible for Peabody retiree health benefits

    • A federal appeals court keeps Peabody Energy (BTU -1.6%) on the hook for health benefits for ~3,100 retired Patriot Coal (OTCQB:PCXCQ +40.2%) miners, a reversal of the bankruptcy judge's earlier ruling that BTU no longer owed the benefits.
    • Patriot praises the ruling, that BTU "should not be permitted to use Patriot's bankruptcy to escape its health care obligations to thousands of retirees."
    • Patriot earlier this year gained court permission to abrogate its labor deals for current and retired workers, and recently agreed to new, cost-cutting deals.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 8 Comments
  • STML

    Stemline plunges double-digits

    • Shares of Stemline Therapeutics (STML -11.2%) are notably lower on the session on no readily apparent news.
    • The shares have doubled over the past three months.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM

  • Stocks reverse course to turn higher

    • Following a knee-jerk reaction sharply lower, stocks turn green after taking a few minutes to digest the FOMC minutes, and maybe figuring the initiation of the taper is old news at this point. The FOMC also seemed to go out of its way to reassure markets it won't try and get ahead of the economic data (though an older breed of bond buyer would find that very much not assuring).
    • S&P 500 (SPY +0.2%), Nasdaq 100 (QQQ +0.4%), DJIA (DIA flat).
    • Other index ETFs: IVV, SPY, VOO, RWL, SFLA, SSO, UPRO, SDS, SPXU, SH, EPS, RSP, BXUB, BXUC, BXDB, QQQ, QQEW, TQQQ, QID, SQQQ, PSQ, QLD, QQQE, DIA, DDM, UDOW, DXD, SDOW, DOG.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • TUES

    Tuesday Morning soars following Q4 loss

    • Shares of Tuesday Morning (TUES +21.9%) soar following the company's FQ4 report.
    • The stock's strength comes despite the company's reported quarterly loss.
    • Perhaps helping to tip sentiment is SA contributor Alan Brochstein's article which was published just as the stock began to rise markedly around 1:30.
    • The company's "turnaround has many of the pieces investors in these types of situations desire," Brochstein says.
    • Also: Conference call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel higher after Kodak bankruptcy plan approved

    • UniPixel (UNXL +5.2%) is catching a bid after touch sensor manufacturing partner Kodak has its restructuring plan approved by a U.S. bankruptcy court.
    • Kodak is planning to sell $406M in stock to finance its efforts to emerge from Chap. 11 as a streamlined provider of commercial printing/imaging and touch sensor solutions.
    • UniPixel announced a partnership with Kodak in April, through which Kodak will produce touch sensors leveraging UniPixel's UniBoss film. Equipment installation started in Q2.
    • Williams Capital is a fan of the deal; Citron Research isn't.
    • Though still well above last fall's levels, shares are down 61% from an April high of $41.42.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • INCY

    Incyte soars on Jakafi pancreatic cancer data but questions remain on subgroup

    • "The challenge for investors is interpreting the results without better understanding this novel subgroup," BofA's Rachel McMinn says, regarding data from a Phase 2 trial of Incyte's (INCY +32.3%) JAK inhibitor Jakafi in patients with metastatic pancreatic cancer.
    • A hazard ratio of 0.47 was reported for a "pre-specified subgroup analysis conducted in patients identified prospectively as most likely to benefit from JAK pathway inhibition." This seems (at least on the surface) to be a bit ambiguous given that the company "had not previously publicly discussed this subgroup, and is keeping the details a secret for competitive reasons."
    • Nevertheless, BofA reiterates a Buy and Wells Fargo's Brian Abrahams maintains a Market Perform rating, noting that "there is a real signal here, which, in our view, opens the door for INCY to considerably broaden Jakafi’s use."
    • Morgan Stanley thinks the pancreatic cancer opportunity for Jakafi is sorely misunderstood by the Street — in MS's view, peak potential pancreatic cancer sales are just $150-180M versus estimates of $500M elsewhere.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM

  • Stocks and bonds slip after FOMC minutes

    • The DJIA (DIA -0.5%), S&P 500 (SPY -0.5%), and Nasdaq 100 (QQQ -0.3%) slip to session lows following FOMC minutes which confirm the Fed's intention to soon initiate the QE taper.
    • Treasury prices had rallied going into the release, but have reversed lower with TLT -0.7% and the 10-year yield jumping 7 bps to 2.89%.
    • Gold slumps 0.6% to $1,364 per ounce, GLD -0.4%, and the dollar (UUP +0.5%) pops.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 5 Comments

  • Taylor Morrison Homes moves up on home sales; CEO purchases shares

    • Taylor Morrison Home Corp (TMHC +2%) moves up on the back of a combination of better than expected July Existing Home Sales and some insider purchases.
    • CEO Sheryl Palmer purchased 5,000 shares on Friday at an average price of $20.50 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • ALVR

    Alvarion gives up some gains as acquisition news settles

    • Shares of Alvarion (ALVR -23.9%) are off sharply today after the stock exploded 511% last week. The run came as speculation swirls over a potential acquisition of the Israeli wireless broadband solutions company, which is in receivership.
    • The deadline for bids was last Thurs. Globes reported that among multiple bids, private Israeli firm Sigma Wave submitted an offer to inject "tens of millions of shekels." The bid is conditioned on acquiring the company as a going concern, bringing employees back to work immediately, and restructuring Alvarion's debt (~$24M).
    • Current equity holders would also face dilution. Sigma Wave's offer proposes new equity issuances of ALVR stock to employees who stay on board.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • VELTF

    No mercy for Velti following Q2 report; RBC cuts to Underperform

    • Velti's (VELT -55%) market cap has fallen to just $30M after the company badly missed Q2 estimates, announced a $111M write-down, and backtracked on a promise to be cash flow positive this year. Needless to say, investors are questioning the mobile ad agency's ability to survive.
    • On the CC, CFO Jeffrey Ross effectively confirmed VentureBeat's deliquent payment reports by stating the Q2 miss was largely due to a "failure to make timely payments to preempt publishers on our Mobclix ad exchange business, which resulted in a substantial decline in that business."
    • He added Velti hasn't been able to "provide sufficient liquidity" for Mobclix, and thus expects it to continue declining.
    • Ross also stated Velti "[remains] in violation of [its] debt covenants with HSBC," but is "in close dialogue with the bank" regarding liquidity needs.
    • COO Mari Baker suggested Velti has "identified areas" where it can make additional job cuts (previous), as well as areas to make new investments.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • OSIS

    OSI Systems lands a 15 year contract with the government of Albania worth up to $250M

    • OSI Systems (OSIS +2.1%) moves up after landing a 15-year contract from the Government of Albania to provide turnkey cargo and vehicle security screening services at various sites throughout the country.
    • Gross revenues are anticipated to range between $150M to $250M over the term of the agreement, although it warned actual revenues could differ significantly based upon the volume of cargo and other factors.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • BEAT

    Details on Dougherty & Co's upgrade of Biotelemetry

    • Here's more detail on Dougherty's upgrade of Cardionet (BEAT +6.4%) earlier today:
    • Dougherty says that in recent years, BEAT has struggled with reimbursement issues and management turnover, but those issues appear to be behind them.
    • The firm believes BioTelemetry has a vision to identify and attack additional markets (beyond cardiology) that would benefit from the application of its wireless platform and proprietary technology, and presents a big opportunity for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • TSL

    Solar stocks continue rallying, with help from Trina

    • Solar stocks, among the biggest standouts in a year that has been very good to many high-beta tech names, have staged a strong two-day rally in the wake of Trina's (TSL +13.2%) Q2 beat and guidance hike.
    • Trina's numbers have sparked three upgrades, the most recent of which came today, courtesy of Cowen.
    • Bloomberg notes Trina, SunPower (SPWR +4.3%), and JinkoSolar (JKS +5.6% - just announced a new 23MW supply deal) are all operating at full capacity, and thinking of expanding.
    • S&P's Angelo Zino: "I think it’s safe to say that we’ll see a number of tier-one manufacturers add capacity, probably in 2014."
    • That would be a positive for equipment suppliers such as AMAT, GTAT, and VECO, who have seen their solar orders plummet as module makers scramble to stabilize crashing prices and margins.
    • Other names rising today: CSIQ +9.7%. SOL +6.7%. YGE +6.2%. JASO +4.2%. CSUN +5.4%. OTC:ASTI +5.1%. STP +3.8%. LDK +4.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 3 Comments

  • Midday top 10 gainers / Losers

    • Midday top 10 gainers: SGOC +31%. INCY +28%. INO +20%. OTC:ATEA +19%. DMND +18%. DGSE +17%. AFFM.OB +16%. SSH +15%. SARA +14%. XRSC +13%.
    • Midday top 10 Losers: VELT -52%. KTCC -15%. SPLS -14%. STV -11%. AEO -10%. NEO -9%. BMJ -8%. NFEC -8%. FFHL -7%. EFUT -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • NBIX

    Neurocrine Biosciences upgraded a Cowen

    Neurocrine Biosciences (NBIX +4%) gains on an upgrade at Cowen from Market Perform to Outperform with a $20 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CE

    Celanese signs MOU to develop synthetic fuel with PetroChina

    • Celanese (CE +4.9%) signs a memorandum of understanding to advance the development of synthetic fuel ethanol in China with PetroChina (NYSE:PTR).
    • The two companies will collaborate to jointly develop synthetic fuel ethanol opportunities utilizing CE's TCX ethanol process technology.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • SARA

    Saratoga Resources +14% after Breton Sound drilling update

    • Saratoga Resources (SARA +14.1%) shares surge after the company provides an update on development drilling activity at the Breton Sound Block 32 field.
    • The Rocky well, the first horizontal well at Breton Sound, was tested yesterday at a gross rate of ~600 boe/day and 120M cf/day, and the rate continues to improve as the well stabilizes.
    • Final costs on the Rocky well are expected to come in below the pre-drill AFE, SARA says.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • VNET

    21Vianet trading down on Q2 results, concerns over margins and delays

    • Shares of 21Vianet (VNET -6%) are trading down following the company's Q2 EPS miss.
    • On the conference call, analysts raised concerns about decreasing EBITDA margins (down 80bp Y/Y on an adjusted basis) and delays in the deployment of the company's Windows Azure and Office 365 offerings. The company is "not sure [about] the deployment time" because the "pricing strategy has not been finalized." CFO Shang-Wen Hsiao warned that awaited revenue from 21Vianet's cloud computing operations could come "towards the very end of the third quarter."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • DS

    Credit Suisse picks over beaten-up mREIT sector

    • The big picture view says better entry points are coming soon - perhaps after the taper actually begins (September?) and a new Fed chief is announced (October?).
    • The team's favorite names are those associated with the sector that really aren't mREITs, but instead have more-specialized business models: Newcastle Investment (NCT +0.5%), its spinoff New Residential (NRZ +1.8%), and PennyMac Mortgage Investment Trust (PMT -0.1%).
    • In the security-focused names, top picks are Two Harbors (TWO -0.8%) and Ellington Financial (EFC +0.1%), and American Capital Mortgage (NASDAQ:MTGE).
    • Thus far in Q3, CS sees sector book values off 4% amid a 40 bp increase in rates. The good news is credit spreads haven't continued to widen, but a coming taper announcement could blow them out again.
    • Sector ETFs: REM, MORT, MORL.
    • Earlier: Two Harbors gets an upgrade.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 8 Comments
  • YOKU

    Youku higher following bullish Macquarie note

    • Macquarie gave Youku (YOKU +5.8%) a two-notch upgrade to Outperform last December.
    • Shares of the Chinese online/mobile video leader sold off earlier this month after its Q2 revenue and Q3 guidance failed to impress, but remain well above their April lows.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAXN

    Taser receives new orders for its Smart Weapons from law enforcement agencies in North Carolina and Nevada

    • Taser International (TASR +3.3%) continues to rack up gains after the weapons company announces multiple Smart Weapons orders from law enforcement agencies in North Carolina and Nevada.
    • The orders were received in Q3 and are expected to ship before the end of the quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • AAXN

    Taser up again on recent smart weapon orders

    • Shares of Taser (TASR +3.2%) continue to climb, extending what is now a 30% under-the-radar rally (previous), which began on August 12 when the shares traded around $8.60.
    • Today, the company released a detailed list of recent smart weapons orders. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • STVVY

    China Digital TV plunges on Q2 results

    • China Digital TV (STV -10.1%) plunges as the market takes in yesterday's Q2 results.
    • The stock is down 52.2% in the last year, as the company's smart card business faces dampened demand and pricing pressure.
    • A potential silver lining: management noted, "We continue to make good overall progress developing markets abroad." Efforts in Taiwan and India are in the early stages but gaining some traction.
    • (CC)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • LLNW

    Limelight CEO buys 25K shares

    • Robert Lento, who only became Limelight's (LLNW +2.5%) permanent CEO in January, bought 25K shares yesterday at $1.97. (Form 4)
    • The purchase comes with shares of the CDN owner, struggling with price pressure, tough competition from Akamai/Level 3, and Netflix's efforts to migrate traffic to its own CDN, trading well below late-2010/early 2011 levels.
    • Previous: Limelight tumbles on Q2 miss
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences gets reimbursement approval for its Sapien XT valve in Japan

    • Edwards Lifesciences (EW +2%) says Japan has given the go-ahead for reimbursement costs of its transcatheter aortic heart value.
    • The reimbursement is scheduled to go into effect on October 1.
    • The rate has been set at ¥4.53M (approximately $46K) for when the valve used in the treatment of patients with severe symptomatic aortic stenosis, and covers the cost of the device as well as taxes, certain hospital fees and distribution expenses.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • DRYS

    DryShips higher following large block trade

    • DryShips (DRYS +2%) trades higher after a 8.3M block trade sets a nice tone.
    • Volume on DRYS is already 2X normal daily activity while shares trade close to the mid-point of the their 52-week range.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 2 Comments
  • BB

    BlackBerry lower; Bloomberg, analysts speculate breakup on tap

    • BlackBerry (BBRY -2.6%) is giving up some more of its recent gains after Bloomberg and contacted analysts suggest the company's phone business is "essentially worthless," and that BlackBerry's other assets (patents, BES, the network operations centers, cash/investments) are only worth ~$5B (current market cap is $5.3B).
    • Fund manager Brian Huen: "Nobody is interested in buying the entire entity. I think they are now in the phase of saying, ‘We will do anything to maximize value, including breaking up the company.'"
    • Canaccord: "The most logical acquirer of BlackBerry would likely attempt to transition BlackBerry’s subscriber base to its own competing smartphone products" BMO thinks it would cost a buyer $800M to shut down BlackBerry's phone unit.
    • However, much of the buyout speculation thus far hasn't involved a rival OEM, but Prem Watsa and his reported efforts to talk to both P-E firms and "industry players" about a bid.
    • Pac Crest recently suggested BlackBerry's purchase commitments will limit the size of any bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 45 Comments
  • ROYL

    Royale Energy +11% on North Slope shale oil report

    • Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL +11.2%) says an outside study shows its shale acreage in Alaska's North Slope is a qualified prospective resource with an average recovery rate of 3,995 bbl/acre of oil, equivalent to ~639K barrels of oil per well drilled.
    • Preparation for a seismic survey has begun, final engagement of the contractor is expected soon, and data should be available by Q2 2014, ROYL says.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 2 Comments
  • KTCC

    Key Tronic plunges on weak Q4 results, outlook

    • Key Tronic (KTCC -16.2%) tumbles after missing FQ4 EPS and revenue estimates.
    • Revenue fell 12.5% Y/Y for the period while gross margin and operating margin slipped 100 bps each.
    • CEO Craig Gates: "Moving into the first quarter of fiscal 2014, we are currently seeing a reduction in orders from another large customer and a few of our new programs are not ramping up as rapidly as anticipated." (PR)
    • Outlook: FQ1 EPS of $0.15-0.20 on revenue of $73-78M. The one available analyst estimate calls for FQ1 EPS of $0.26.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • TSL

    Trina adds to post-earnings gains following Cowen upgrade

    • Cowen has lifted Trina (TSL +7.5%) to Outperform in the wake of yesterday morning's Q2 beat and full-year guidance hike. Its PT is now at $10.
    • Maxim and Ardour Capital upgraded Trina yesterday.
    • Trina mentioned on its Q2 CC it has redeemed all outstanding convertible debt in Q3 ($57M was remaining at the end of Q2). Total debt at the end of Q2 amounted to $1.12B, and cash/equivalents totaled $619M.
    • The company's total manufacturing cost/watt fell at a "high single-digit" rate in Q2. However, Trina added its polysilicon costs are expected stabilize or rise slightly in Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • BEAT

    Dougherty sets high price target for BioTelemetry

    • Dougherty initiates coverage of BioTelemetry (NASDAQ:BEAT) with a "Buy" rating and sets a target price $15.
    • Last week, SA author Markos Kaminis selected BioTelemetry, previously called CardioNet, as a small-cap growth pick following its Q2 earnings.
    • Shares are +6.2% at $7.76.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • GASS

    StealthGas maintains Buy rating at Jefferies

    • Jefferies cuts its earnings estimates and price target to $14 from $16 for StealthGas (GASS +1.7%) but maintains a Buy rating following Q2 earnings that fell far short of estimates.

  • INCY

    Icyte share jump following Jakafi results

    • Incyte (NASDAQ:INCY) shares rocket 17.6% after it says that an overall survival analysis of the Phase II trial of its ruxolitinib treatment for advanced pancreatic cancer achieved a hazard ratio of 0.79. Ruxolitinib, also known as Jakafi, was given along with the capecitabine chemotherapy.
    • In a subgroup of patients most likely to benefit from ruxolitini, the hazard ratio was 0.47 and the six-month survival rate was 42% vs 11% for a placebo.
    • Only patients receiving ruxolitinib showed tumor responses and a significant improvement in body weight relative to placebo.
    • Jakafi recently received the FDA's Orphan Drug designation for pancreatic cancer.
    • (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM

  • RBI moves to restore liquidity to Indian banking system

    • The Reserve Bank of India has has said it will buy 80B rupees ($1.26B) of long-dated government bonds on Friday and reduce weekly sales of cash-management bills to rein in a surge in yields. The bank could make further purchases, depending on market conditions.
    • The move comes after a series of tightening measures that unsuccessfully attempted to stem the free-fall in the rupee. Not only did the measures fail, they also caused a cash crunch that led banks to raise deposit and lending rates.
    • Indian shares are -1.4%, adding to sharp falls over the last few sessions.
    • Yields on 10-year government bonds plunge 57 bps to 8.35%.
    • However, the rupee weakens again after recovering yesterday following RBI intervention in the currency markets. The USD-INR is +1.45% at 64.04.
    • ETFs - Stocks: INDY, EPI, PIN, INP, INDA, INXX, SCIF, SCIN, INDL, SMIN. Currency: ICN, INR (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 AM
